properties.headline: Coffs Harbour Show - Friday 30 April to Sunday 2 May - COFFS HARBOUR Pacific Highway between Marcia Street AND Beryl Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Coffs Harbour show is taking place from Friday 30 April to Sunday 2 May at Coffs Harbour Showground. 

The turning lanes of the Pacific Hwy will be closed in both directions between Marcia St and Beryl St from 7am to 11pm each day.

Motorists should take care while travelling in the area and allow extra travel time.
properties.displayName: Coffs Harbour Show - Friday 30 April to Sunday 2 May

properties.headline: Greek Easter Services - Sunday 25 April to Saturday 1 May - BURWOOD Railway Parade and Burleigh Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place for Greek Orthodox Easter Services at Saint Nectarios Church on 25 April, 30 April and 1 May. 

Sunday 25 April

  • Burleigh St will be closed from Railway Pde to the driveway of 24 Railway Pde from 9.30am until 11.30am. 

Friday 30 April 

  • Railway Pde from Burwood Rd to Shaftesbury Rd, and Burleigh St from Railway Pde to Elizabeth St will be closed from 8pm to 9pm. 
  • Rolling road closures will be in place on sections of Railway Pde, Burwood Rd, Belmore St and Shaftesbury Rd between 9pm and 10pm.
  • Railway Pde will close again at the conclusion of the procession between Burwood Rd and Shaftesbury Rd from 10pm to 11pm. 

Saturday 1 May

  • Railway Pde from Burwood Rd to Shaftesbury Rd, and Burleigh St from Elizabeth St to Railway Pde will be closed from 11pm until 12:30am Sunday 2 May. 

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic control on site.
properties.displayName: Greek Easter Services - Sunday 25 April to Saturday 1 May

properties.headline: Street festival - Saturday 8 May - ROCKDALE Walz Street between Railway Street AND Watkin Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan at Bayside will be held on Walz Street in Rockdale on Saturday 8 May from 7pm until 11:30pm. 

Walz St between Railway St and Watkin St, and Walz Lane between Waltz St and Frederick Lane will be closed from 5pm Saturday until 1am Sunday.

Special event clearways will be in place on both sides of Walz St between Railway St and Watkin St from 4:30pm to 8:30pm, and from 4:30pm until midnight on Railway St between Walz St and 85 Railway St (western side) and Watkin St between Parker St and Walz St (eastern side).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.30pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 1 May - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium road closure and detour map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium road closure and detour map

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Sydney Derby: Western Sydney Wanderers v Sydney FC at Bankwest Stadium from 7:10pm until 9pm approx.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as thousands of fans travel to the stadium. Roads on approach to the stadium may be temporarily closed as crowds make their way to the game. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Fans driving to the game should arrive early as parking will be in high demand. 

Roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time from around 8.30pm for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Expect delays and follow directions of traffic control and Police on site while closures are in place.

properties.otherAdvice:
Monster Truck Mania at Qudos Bank Arena from 7pm to 9.45pm on Saturday and from 1pm to 3.45pm on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as thousands of fans travel to shows over the weekend.

An NRL game is also being held at neighbouring Stadium Australia on Saturday night from 5.30pm. Parking will be in high demand so pre-book your parking at Sydney Olympic Park online ahead of time to secure a space.

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 343, 357 and 418 will be diverting around Gardeners Rd while closures are in place. Check transportnsw.info bus alerts for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:

Motorists should allow extra travel time and expect delays in the area while closures are in place.

Todays road closures

Saturday 1 May - 11pm to 1:30am

  • Gardeners Rd westbound lanes from General Bridge Cres to Isaac Smith St
  • Gardeners Rd eastbound lanes from Cottenham Ave to Isaac Smith St

Eastbound motorists will be detoured via Cottenham Ave and Borrodale Rd to join Anzac Pde.

Westbound motorists will be detoured via Cook Ave and Isaac Smith St to rejoin Gardeners Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Triathlon - Sunday 9 May - BYRON BAY Bangalow Rd at Broken Head Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,500 people will take part in the 26th annual Byron Bay Triathlon from 6:20am to approx 10:30am Sunday morning.  

From 6am to 10am, Broken Head Rd will be closed from Beech Dr, Suffolk Park to Bangalow Rd and this closure will continue along Bangalow Rd to Browning St, Byron Bay. 

Local roads around Byron Bay will also be closed between 4am and 12pm midday including sections of Bay St, Middleton St, Marvell St, Tennyson St, Lawson St, Bangalow Rd and Broken Head Rd.

Traffic is expected to be heavy along Ewingsdale Rd from the M1 Pacific Mwy and on Bangalow Rd as motorists travel to the event and Byron Bay township while local roads are closed. 

Detours will be in place throughout the morning. A vehicle crossover point will be managed at Ruskin St, Browning St and Kingsley St. 

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian and cyclist activity.

webLinks.linkText: Mudgee Cycle Classic 2021 - closures and local access

properties.headline: Cycling event - Sunday 2 May - MUDGEE, RYLSTONE, LUE Lue Road between Ulan Road AND Bylong Valley Way, Bylong
properties.otherAdvice:
The Mudgee Cycle Classic includes three courses, the 170km Maxi Classic, the 120km Challenge Classic and the 35km Social Classic.

The ride starts on Church St, Mudgee between 7am and 8am. Riders will travel from Mudgee to Rylstone, the Bylong Valley, Lue and return to finish at the Glen Willow Regional Sports Complex, Mudgee by 4pm.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions will be in place along the route: 

From 4am to 9am 

  • Church St will be closed between Short St and Mortimer St
  • Mortimer St will be closed between Perry St and the Kmart Carpark entrance

From 6:30am to 4pm

  • Lue Rd will be closed to general traffic between Ulan Rd and Bylong Valley Way. Motorists can use the Castlereagh Hwy as an alternative route.
  • Local traffic only will be permitted under escort. All side roads leading to Lue Rd will also be closed during this time.
  • Speed limits will be reduced along Lue Rd during the event.
  • Pitts Lane in Mudgee will be closed

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police.

Motorists should exercise caution as they share roads along the course with cyclists during the event. Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at the SCG from 4:05pm to approx 6pm

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and around Moore Park as soccer fans travel to the SCG for this Sydney derby. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 2pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm to 7pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FROM 1PM TO 7PM - SUNDAY 23 MAY

  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: Cycle Ride - Saturday 8 May - GRAFTON TO INVERELL Gwydir Highway
properties.otherAdvice:
A large group of cyclists will take part in the Grafton to Inverell Cycle Classic on Saturday 8 May, starting from Prince St in Grafton and finishing on Vivian St in Inverell. The race will commence at 7:15am and the last riders are expected to reach Inverell by 5pm

The Gwydir Hwy will be closed in both directions between Bent St and Tindal Rd from 7am to 8:30am. The highway will also be closed between Tindal Rd and Bald Knob Rd to eastbound traffic from 5am to 2pm and in both directions from 7am to 2pm.

Elsmore Rd will be under traffic control for the event and motorists travelling in the area should allow extra travel time. Local traffic will have limited access to this road during this period.

Speed reductions will also be in place along the Gwydir Hwy during the event and motorists should be aware of speed reduction signs and traffic controllers on site. 

Motorists should be aware of the groups of cyclists as they share roads each day. Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

properties.headline: Greek Easter procession - Friday 30 April - DARLINGTON Abercrombie Street between Codrington Street AND Shepherd Street,
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays, check transportnsw.info for service disruptions.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around the Church of the Assumption of Our Lady in Darlington will be closed for a Greek Easter procession on Friday evening.

A short term closure of Abercromibie St between Codrington St and Shepherd St will be in place from 8:30pm.

Motorists can detour via Wilson St.

Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

properties.headline: Greek Easter procession - Friday 30 April - NEWTOWN King Street between Enmore Road AND Alice Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays, check transportnsw.info for service disruptions.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around the St Constantine & St Helens Greek Orthodox Church in Newtown will be closed for a Greek Easter procession on Friday evening.

Road closures will be in place between 8.40pm and 9.40pm on the following roads:

  • King St between Enmore Rd and Alice St
  • Whitehorse St between King St and Newman St
  • Newman St between King St and Whitehorse St

Motorists should avoid King St between Sydney Park Rd and Enmore Rd while closures are in place. Motorists travelling south can detour around the closure via Enmore Rd. Motorists travelling north can detour around the closure via Alice St and Enmore Rd. 

Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

properties.headline: Greek Easter procession - Friday 30 April - SURRY HILLS Cleveland Street between George Street AND Pitt Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays, check transportnsw.info for service disruptions.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around the Cathedral of The Annunciation of Our Lady Greek Orthodox Church in Surry Hills will be closed for a Greek Easter procession on Friday evening.

Rolling road closures will be in place between 9pm and 9.45pm on the following roads:

  • George St between Cleveland St and Redfern St
  • Redfern St between George St and Pitt St
  • Pitt St between Redfern St and Cleveland St
  • Cleveland St between Regent St and Chalmers St

Motorists can detour via Regent St, Raglan St and Chalmers St or Elizabeth St.

Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

properties.headline: Greek Easter Service - Friday 30 April & Saturday 1 May - MASCOT Coward Street between O'Riordan Street AND Botany Lane
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around the closure. Check transportnsw.info bus alerts for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Greek Easter service at St Catherine Greek Orthodox Church on Friday 30th April from 7pm to 11pm and on Saturday 1 May from 10:30pm to 2:30am.

Road closures will be in place from 9pm until 10.30pm for a procession on Friday:

  • Coward St between O’Riordan St and Botany Rd
  • Oliver St between Coward St and Forster St
  • Forster St between Oliver St and Aloha St
  • Aloha St between Forster St and Coward St

Lane closures will also be in place on Saturday on Coward St outside the church from 11pm until 2:30am Sunday. 

Motorists can detour around the closure via King St.
properties.displayName: Greek Easter Service - Friday 30 April & Saturday 1 May

properties.headline: Greek Easter procession - Friday 30 April - MARRICKVILLE Livingstone Road between Jersey Street AND Francis Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays, check transportnsw.info for service disruptions.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around St Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church in Marrickville will be closed for a Greek Easter procession on Friday evening.

Road closures will be in place between 8.40pm and 9.40pm approx on the following roads:

  • Livingstone Rd between Jersey St and Francis St
  • Robert St between Livingstone Rd and Dot St
  • Dot St
  • South St between Dot St and Pine St
  • Pine St between South St and Hollands Ave
  • Hollands Ave between Pine St and Livingstone Rd

Motorists should avoid Livingstone Rd between Jersey St and Francis St during the closure. Motorists can detour via Illawarra Rd or Wardell Rd.

Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

properties.headline: Police operation - Saturday 1 May - PARRAMATTA Marist Place, Marsden Street, George Street, Horwood Place and Phillip Street
properties.publicTransport: The Parramatta free shuttle will not run while roads are closed. Buses may experience delays. Check transportnsw.info service alerts for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling road closures will be in place on sections of Marist Pl, Marsden St, George St, Horwood Pl and Phillip St from 12pm until 1pm for a police operation. Roads will progressively re-open when safe to do so.

Motorists should use O'Connell St and Smith St/Wilde Ave instead while closures are in place. While Phillip St is closed motorists should use George St.

Expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

roads.mainStreet: Marist Place, Marsden Street, George Street, Horwood Place and Phillip Street
